HowToSection.title: How to participate
HowToSection.desc: There are many ways to get started finding a bug bounty. You can start by connecting to the DeFiChain testnet by running <0>defid -testnet</0>. Alternatively, you could study our source code at <1>GitHub</1>. If you find a bug through interacting with our program and/or studying our source code, we can offer a bug bounty of up to USD 50,000 worth of DFI provided that we find the bug significant, and you are able to provide useful info in regards to fixing or reproducing the issue.
HowToSection.bolded: Be sure to study the code that is tagged for official releases, not the master branch or other code that is still currently under development.

SubmissionSection.title: Submission process
SubmissionSection.desc: As security is a sensitive issue, we encourage users not to submit public issues regarding the security of the blockchain. We encourage using your own discretion, if you feel the issue is not something the public can easily exploit, then feel free to create an issue at the repo over at <0>GitHub</0>. If the issue presents some critical exploit, then please email us instead at <1>security@defichain.com</1>.

list.title: In your submission please include:
entries: A clear description of the issue
A fix for the issue, preferably as a pull request
If unable to provide a fix, then please provide clear directions on how to reproduce the issue
Your email address or other relevant contact details (e.g. Telegram ID)
Your DFI address for receiving the bounty if your submission is approved
